Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles G Thiele was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AODA Assessment and Drivers Safety Plan.

miscConds.notes: Paid in full.  Taken out of cash bond posted.
Paid in full.  Taken out of cash bond posted.

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this State unless authorized to do so by DMV.
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle anywhere with any amount of alcohol or restricted controlled substances in his system.

Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall receive Alcohol and other Drug Assessment from Waupaca County DHHS or other licensed agency as determined by Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations including establishment of a driver safety plan.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant granted good time credit.

Consecutive to: to 14CF371.

records.addlTxt: elements

A.D.A. Isherwood appeared for the state.
Defendant appeared in person with Atty. Johnson.
Plea quest. and waiver of rights form filed.
The defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 2, PAC 5th offense.  Plea accepted by the Court after rights were explained and defendant found guilty as to Count 2. Count 1 is dismissed and read in.
The Court imposes and stays prison term of 18 months ITOC and 3 years EXS, and places the defendant on probation for a period of 3 years. This sentence is consecutive to the sentence imposed in 14 CF 371. 
Conditions:  1) Defendant to serve 6 months in jail, on each case, each count consecutive, with good time and  with huber privileges. 2)  Defendant to pay a fine of $600.00 plus costs (total: $1736.50). 3) Defendant to undergo and complete AODA, DSP, and any other counseling deemed appropriate by the agent, and to abide by all treatment recommendations. 4) Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 5) Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this state unless authorized by the Motor Vehicle Department. 6) Defendant shall not operate a vehicle anywhere with any amount of alcohol or restricted controlled substances in system. 7)  Driver's license revocation for a period of 36 months, with credit. 8) Defendant to operate vehicles equipped only with IID for a period of 36 months.  
Note: If any restitution is ordered in 14 CM 173, payment of same will become a condition of probation in this case. 
Any cash bond held shall be applied to fine and costs.
Appeal rights, voting and firearms restrictions were provided.
